title: League of Knockups (New Nunu)
body:
The Nunu rework is cute and all, and it seems to be a pretty good rework thematically for them.  I have a problem with it though

It's another champ with a knockup.

What's the point of tenacity anymore when every CC is a knockup?  The ability shouldn't even knock up thematically.

Imagine a giant snowball is rolling towards you.  When it hits you what is going to happen?

A. You get knocked down
B. You get knocked down and stunned by the impact
C. You get knocked backwards by the impact.  
D. You magically get thrown _upwards_ by a snowball rolling _over_ you

Seriously though why is this even a thing? Why does every kit now need to have a knockup in it?  This ability would be a cool application of the Knockdown ability like Poppy has, so that if for example a Tristana tries to jump away from you but jumps into the snowball it would knock her down. Why a knockup?

replies.body: I think this is valid feedback.  It should cause a small 0.1 second displacement in the direction of impact and then a regular stun.  Seems easy enough to change.  Hopefully, Riot reads this.

Most Knockbacks tend to be shorter than actual Stuns or Roots though, that's why they aren't affected by Tenacity. I think the longest to date is either Yasuo's or Jannas. Then, arguably, it's actually easier to balance a Champ kit's around the fact that they'll always have this reliable CC that always last this long, no more, no less. 

It's like the argument of Grevious Wounds on Vlad. (They need to balance him around the fact that GV exists, and so his healing is really strong without it, so that he isn't completely butt fucked when someone buys GV for him). If Tenacity exists, then some champions can't do their job properly, and so, the CC that is affected needs to be longer. This in turn, fucks over the people who don't buy Tenacity. A lot of Mages can only survive on their range and CC.

Then how about we get rid of tenacity, or rework it so that it gives extra tank stats while affected by any  cc. Right now it just seems like some sort of superfluous trap option that only helps in very niche circumstances, yet is offered in incredibly accessible ways. I would rather Merc Treads just have extra MR than their current passive, since the champs that you need good MR protection *and* CC resistance against is pretty much just Veigar and Morgana, and basic attack reduction is much more universally useful.
Put it on an item that isn't a boot. If Tenacity was on an item that required a real investment then perhaps they could lay off on the irreducible CC.

Not going to disagree with this, tenacity is super easy to pick up on anyone and so they make it not worth it for anyone. The thing is, if the current version of tenacity is unhealthy then limiting it to a specific subset of champs isn't going to solve the problem.

Mind you, a knockback is not the same as a knockup as there is also speed involved. What would tenacity do with knockbacks?
a) reduce the time of knockbacks so the distance knocked back is also reduced
b) increase the speed of knockbacks so the distance is maintained but you are faster knocked back
Both are not really always good. And on top of that, I doubt riot could even pull off either off the two seeing how most knock backs are still bugged.

Displacement could perhaps make some thematic sense, but then carries entirely different gameplay implications, as you'd be pushing enemies away from Nunu, which isn't something any part of his kit really wants.

Said it a trillion times, will add here yet again:

Restore the CC triangle.

Normal CC (Stun/snare/root/etc.) is long (3+ seconds) but hardcountered by tenacity and QSS.
Displacement is short and can't be countered but no longer stuns when being moved. (Can flash/dash out of it if you're quick enough)
Suppression is the longest and can only be QSS'd but is rare and often requires a channel.

Right now the triangle is:

Normal CC which is just as long as displacement but countered by tenacity.
Displacement which is short and uncounterable.
Rare suppressions which are the same.
Tenacity has been useless for a long time. Most CCs are some kind of displacement rigth now.

We need to add a Steadfast ability or a Size to things that affects Knockups like Tenacity does to stuns/slows/roots

Size would be a good one.

Things have a Size ranging from 1 to 6 
Minion (melee, caster) has Size 1
Cannon has size 2
Siege Minions are size 3
Blue/Red are Size 4

Normal Human champs have Size 3
Cho'Goth starts out as Size 2 and ends at size 4
Zac ranges from size 2 to 4

Elemental Drakes, Rift Herald are Size 5
Elder Drake is size 6

Knockups have a power that will knockup anything less then or equal to its power and interrupt anything more then its power.

Yasuo Tornado has power 3
Sion Knockup is Power 2-4 as he charges it
Reksai knockup is power 4
Aatrox knockup is power 2,3,4

Lulu Ult adds +2 to Size

Some champs could have passives or abilities that add to their size for a short time (out side of Zac and Cho)
Even some champs could be Size 4 by default like Sej, Sion, Mundo, Malphite, Urgot

You're probably right, so how about we rework tenacity. Instead of CC duration decrease have it give increased survivability while under the effects of any crowd control.

Ex:

15 Tenacity

A. While under the effects of any CC you will have 15% physical and magical damage resistance.

Or

B. While under the effects of any CC you will gain 15% damage resistance every second (capped at 60%, increase and cap is halved for slows). 0.5 seconds after being freed from CC, damage resistance will begin to decay to nothing over 1.0 second.

The numbers can be played with, but this would prevent tenacity from messing with combo timings, would keep it a tank stat, and would actually make it desireable for high CC teams.

I was also a bit disheartened that it had a knock-up tacked onto it. I didn't think it was necessary. Maybe if the snowball was rolled big enough? Maybe?

But I really don't want to see anymore micro-CC abilities anymore. Knock-ups or otherwise. It defeats the purpose of ever building tenacity and therefore relying more on champs that have the extra mobility to dodge it.
